chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tomas Barajas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Concur to ct 4. To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).
Concurrent with: ct 4

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 9/16/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

1:57 PM Defendant Tomas Barajas in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Tomas Barajas.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy L McMiller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 3 and 4.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #  3 to Misd A Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-abandon vehicle w/in 24 hrs 943.23(3m) . 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #  1, 2 .
Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 3
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in Dane County Jail, cc to ct 4 (to be served WSP)

COUNT # 4
Court sentences DE to:
-serve 3 years in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 1 year
-extended supervision: 2 years
-cc to 19CF1976

Challenge Incarceration Program: Not Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

-Days credit to jail and prison: 103 (6/5/22-9/15/22)

CONDITIONS ct 4

-No contact with: SDK
-Not use/possess alcohol
-Ban: 2500 blk of E Mifflin St, Madison, WI
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Restitution: State has 14 days to file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #3, 4
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on ES

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Pre-trial conference on August 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Orally on record

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 12

10:12 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to find cts 1, 2, 3, 4 transactionally related. Defn has no objection. CT finds that cts 1, 2, 3, 4 are transactionally related. Madison Police Officer C. D., duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA Verhoff. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Breun. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over, waived argument. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 12.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Atty Breun
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Defendant shall not be in the 2500 block of E Mifflin St. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Scott K. 
- Defendant shall not operate any motor vehicle not registered to the defendant without written consent from the lawful owner on their person. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

02:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
